newsitem.title: USA: New Haven, Conn., to cut sewer-use rates by 5 pct.
newsitem.headline: New Haven, Conn., to cut sewer-use rates by 5 pct.

text.p: New Haven customers of the city's Water Pollution Control Authority (WPCA) will have their sewer-use rates cut by five percent on July 1, New Haven Mayor John DeStefano Jr. said Thursday.
Rates have held stable for the past five years.
WPCA serves 200,000 customers, including 23,000 in New Haven. The others are in several neighboring towns.

"The WPCA has done a good job in the last five years of enacting cost-control measures that have spared ratepayers from an increase during a time when higher utility rates have become the norm," DeStefano said.-Hartford buro (860)727-0224
